keywords.indexterm: DITA Map to PDF WYSIWYG Transformation Tracked changes

body.p: The comments and tracked changes can be made visible in the PDF output by setting the show.changes.and.comments transformation parameter to yes.
By default they are shown as PDF text annotation and they will be visible in the document, but also in the Comments view of Acrobat Reader when opening the output file.

The comments and changes are included in the merged map as XML elements: oxy-insert,oxy-delete,oxy-comment,oxy-attributes when using the direct transformation, or, when using the DITA Map PDF - based on HTML5 & CSS transformation, as HTML elements having one of the class oxy-insert, oxy-delete, oxy-comment, oxy-attributes. Sub-elements contain meta-information about each change.
body.note: These elements are automatically recognized and transformed in PDF annotations when using Chemistry as PDF processor.

To avoid rendering the elements as PDF annotations and show them as footnotes instead, you can use the -noPDFAnnotationsForChangeTrackingAndComments command line parameter. You will need to change the build.xml file from the plugin.
